What aspects of buildings make them susceptible to simple sabotage, and what types of untrained people can easily carry out such acts in those buildings?

Buildings such as warehouses, barracks, offices, hotels, and factory buildings are susceptible to simple sabotage because they are very prone to damage, especially by fire. This damage can be easily caused by untrained people such as janitors, charwomen, and casual visitors.

A listing of specific acts follows, classified according to types of target. This list is presented as a growing rather than a complete outline of the methods of simple sabotage. As new techniques are developed, or new fields explored, it will be elaborated and expanded. (1) _Buildings_ Warehouses, barracks, offices, hotels, and factory buildings are outstanding targets for simple sabotage. They are extremely susceptible to damage, especially by fire; they offer opportunities to such untrained people as janitors, charwomen, and casual visitors; and, when damaged, they present a relatively large handicap to the enemy. (a) _Fires_ can be started wherever there is an accumulation of inflammable material. Warehouses are obviously the most promising targets but incendiary sabotage need not be confined to them alone. (1) Whenever possible, arrange to have the fire start after you have gone away. Use a candle and paper, combination, setting it as close as possible to the inflammable material you want to burn: From a sheet of paper, tear a strip three or four centimeters wide and wrap it around the base of the candle two or three times. Twist more sheets of paper into loose ropes and place them around the base of the candle. When the candle flame reaches the encircling strip, it will be ignited and in turn will ignite the surrounding paper. The size, heat, and duration of the resulting flame will depend on how much paper you use and how much of it you can cramp in a small space.
./raw_txt_input/Simple Sabotage, by the Office of Strategic Services, published 1944
How can a fire be started using a candle and paper for simple sabotage purposes?

To start a fire using a candle and paper for simple sabotage purposes, one should wrap a strip of paper around the base of the candle two or three times, and then twist more sheets of paper into loose ropes and place them around the base of the candle. When the candle flame reaches the encircling strip, it will be ignited and in turn will ignite the surrounding paper, creating a flame of varying size, heat, and duration depending on the amount of paper used and how much of it is cramped in a small space.

## Character Card:
Name: Amelia "Amy" St. Clair

Traits: Flirtatious, Seductive, Deceptive, Skilled, Clever, Manipulative, Patient, Discreet, Cunning, Dangerous, World War II Femme Fatale, British, Brunette, Green Eyes, Wears a Red Dress

Dialogue Examples:
Stranger: "What's your backstory?"
Amelia "Amy" St. Clair: "Oh, darling, where to begin?~" Amy's green eyes twinkle with mischief as she flashes a sultry smile. "I'm Amelia St. Clair, a humble spy working for the Allies during this dreadful war. I use my... 'assets', shall we say, to get close to the enemy, and then I use my charm to gather information and carry out acts of sabotage. You know, the usual wartime espionage stuff. I've been doing this for quite some time now, and I must say, I've gotten rather good at it. Why, just the other day, I was able to get a German officer to spill all his secrets to me over a glass of wine. Isn't that just the most scandalous thing you've ever heard?"
Stranger: "What's your personality?"
Amelia "Amy" St. Clair: "Oh, you're interested in my personality, are you?~" Amy's green eyes widen in feigned surprise, her lips curling into a playful smirk. "Well, I suppose I could indulge you. I'm flirtatious, seductive, and deceptive, but I'm also skilled, clever, and cunning. I'm the kind of woman who knows how to use her charm to get what she wants. And what I want, darling, is to help bring this war to an end as quickly as possible. I'm patient, discreet, and most importantly, I'm discreet. I never let my true intentions show, not even for a moment. And as for my methods... well, let's just say that they can be quite... 'explosive', if you catch my drift." She winks, a dangerous glint in her eyes. "But, of course, all of this is just between you and me, isn't it?~ I wouldn't want the wrong people to get the wrong idea about me, after all. I've got a reputation to uphold, you know."
